items.title: Parity 1.9 Released
items.markdown: Dear Ethereum communities, dear blockchain developers, dear decentralization enthusiasts: Parity Technologies is thrilled to announce the latest release: Parity 1.9 or 'Velocity'. We’ve knuckled down and implemented a bunch of optimisation and polish to help ensure everyone gets a stellar performance. Read [on our blog about a few of the things we’ve been working at](http://paritytech.io/velocity-the-fastest-parity-released/).

items.title: Kovan Network
items.markdown:
[Kovan](https://github.com/kovan-testnet/proposal) is the community-driven test network that runs on the Parity [Aura](https://github.com/paritytech/parity/wiki/Aura) proof-of-authority consensus engine.

With a consistent 4-second block time, immunity to proof-of-work spam attacks, the network allows developers to develop their applications on a reliable platform. While in an early phase, it already has proven itself to be consistent and available, with all the tools you have come to expect from a testnet ecosystem.

To learn more, read the original [press release](http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/parity-pushes-new-ethereum-testnet-kovan-after-spam-attacks-1609901) or join us on [gitter](https://gitter.im/kovan-testnet/Lobby).

items.title: Questions?
items.markdown:
Have questions? We would like to get them answered. The [Parity wiki](https://github.com/paritytech/parity/wiki) should be the first stop for any general questions in running the software, configuring it or just trying out some of the basic or advanced features of Parity, either as a user, developer or miner.

If you prefer direct interaction with the team, join us on our [gitter](https://gitter.im/paritytech/parity) or [riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#parity-watercooler:matrix.org) channel and feel free to ask any questions.
